tags: a song of ice and fire
i stg she'd better be ok
summary: So there's a theory that what's chasing Arya in the trailer is her dead family members, raised from the Winterfell Crypts by the...
body:
So there’s a theory that what’s chasing Arya in the trailer is her dead family members, raised from the Winterfell Crypts by the Walkers. As much as that’s a delightfully horrific theory and all, it just doesn’t hold water.

By this point, her dead family members are down to just bones. The only one who mightn’t be is Rickon – I’m not sure how much time has passed since he was killed, but there’s a possibility that there’s enough of him left to get up and start chasing people.

But Ned, Robb – even Catelyn. They threw the Lady Stoneheart plot away in the show, so Catelyn died at the same time as Robb, and it’s been so long now that their bodies will have been reduced to just bones. As as dramatic as it would be to have literal skeletons chasing people, there’s actually no way for them to do so. Skeletons on their own can’t move. They do actually need the muscles and tendons. Without them, bones won’t even hold together, much less actually move.

So it’s MAYBE Rickon, cause he mightn’t have rotted away to just bones yet – and yes, that would be horrifying – but honestly I think it’s been too long even for him.

I think best case scenario its just a standard nameless wight, or worst case scenario, an actual Walker. Honestly, that’s what my money is on. That kind of terror – in Arya, who’s pretty damn fearless – would only be elicited by something like an actual White Walker, not just a reanimated dead person.

It could also be a wight-Littlefinger, because he was killed recently enough that his body wouldn’t have degraded past the point of usefulness, but my money is on a Walker.

summary: She heard them coming long before she saw them. Hot Pie was breathing heavily, and once he stumbled in the dark, barked his...
text:
She heard them coming long before she saw them. Hot Pie was breathing heavily, and once he stumbled in the dark, barked his shin, and cursed loud enough to wake half of Harrenhal. Gendry was quieter, but the swords he was carrying rang together as he moved. “Here I am.” She stood. “Be quiet or they’ll hear you.”
The boys picked their way toward her over tumbled stones. Gendry was wearing oiled chainmail under his cloak, she saw, and he had his blacksmith’s hammer slung across his back. Hot Pie’s red round face peered out from under a hood. He had a sack of bread dangling from his right hand and a big wheel of cheese under his left arm. “There’s a guard on that postern,” said Gendry quietly. “I told you there would be.”
“You stay here with the horses,” said Arya. “I’ll get rid of him. Come quick when I call.”
Gendry nodded.

summary:
I just had a thought... 
We know that Arya is heavily compared to Lyanna in the books so what if the first thing she say to Jon...
body:
I just had a thought…

We know that Arya is heavily compared to Lyanna in the books so what if the first thing she say to Jon in the show when she they are reunited is the first thing that Lyanna said to Ned when he found her at the Tower of Joy

“Is that you ? Is that really you? I missed you, big brother”

That would be a perfect moment to show the parallels between her and Arya, while also making this moment really memorable and heartbreaking.

What do you guys think??

summary: “Swift as a deer. Quiet as a shadow. Fear cuts deeper than swords. Quick as a snake. Calm as still water. Fear cuts deeper than...
caption:
“Swift as a deer. Quiet as a shadow. Fear cuts deeper than swords. Quick as a snake. Calm as still water. Fear cuts deeper than swords. Strong as a bear. Fierce as a wolverine. Fear cuts deeper than swords. The man who fears losing has already lost. Fear cuts deeper than swords. Fear cuts deeper than swords. Fear cuts deeper than swords.” 

- Arya IV, A Game of Thrones

summary:
Does it villainize any of the main human characters?
That trailer was all about the Key characters (four instead of five) It...
body:
What truly was the theme of that trailer..

Does it villainize any of the main human characters?

That trailer was all about the Key characters (four instead of five) It starts with Arya setting up the main focus of the trailer Death, she knows death & it’s many faces. Night King is the embodiment of death & by that another face of death. Then Bran accomplishing one of his important tasks this season, revealing Jon his true identity. Then starts the dialogue that sounds like Jon addressing the Northerners, who am sure will blab about daenerys & the dragons being in Winterfell & Jon basically reminding them who the real enemy actually is. He is defending Daenerys as north’s friend not a foe!

This trailer was about the common enemy all these characters will have to face together.

They’re Coming.

Our Enemy doesn’t Tire.

I love how the scene placements were done in this trailer. Specially for this ☝️ particular shot with the word TIRE. Because in a way both Dany & Jon are tired of the life, responsibilities, unwanted surprises & burdens that were thrust upon them

“Her whole life had been one long flight, it seemed. She had begun running in her mother’s womb, and never once stopped.”

-Daenerys ACOK

“I am tired of fighting. It’s all I’ve done since I left home..”

-Jon S06E04.

Both of them are tired in one or the other way of the things that they have faced all through their lives, that now upon receiving such a revelation both of them would have appreciated some extra time to deal with it but unlike them who are living breathing humans, whose enemies are neither each other nor the North, their real enemy is the Night King & the Dead & they don’t ever tire.

Doesn’t Stop.

Gendry is in the show the last of the Baratheon line & a lot of people sensed tension between him & dany. The blood thirst that Robert showed towards targaryens, maybe gendry is the Baratheon, literally said to be a mirror of Roberts youth who puts a stop to the enemity with the Targaryens. He has been beyond the wall & knows daenerys & her dragons are the best chance at defence the living have!

Ser Jorah is Ned Stark’s fugitive in the north they still remember his crimes But even he has stopped his crimes, he isn’t a slaver anymore. Unlike the Night King he is a changed man. The night king has been at this creating an army against the living since the time Children of the forest lived in Westeros. He doesn’t Stop. He is the real enemy not Baratheon against Targaryen or Ser Jorah against the Justice of the North, but the Living against the Dead.

Doesn’t Feel.

am sure during the Northern Council northerners brought up the presence of a Targaryen along with foreign “slaves & savage” soldiers like Unsullied & the Dothraki. But these are first & the foremost humans who feel just like anyone in the council can feel, unlike the Dead who do not feel anything. Hence they aren’t the enemies either.

The Kingslayer is North’s fav enemy/Lost Prisoner. Plus also a Lannister. Jaime is an emotional fool even he feels things. Like Jon said in season 7 

“Jon: He’s right! We’re all on the same side.  

Gendry: How can we be?   

Jon: We’re all breathing." 

Plus Jaime himself said in the trailer that he wants to fight for the living. "I promised to fight for the living & I intend to keep that promise”

Hell the trailer even humanized Cersei ffs as someone who feels things. There is only one enemy to look forward to which is the Night King, only one enemy that matters to Jon & only one that he thinks should be fiercely opposed by the North which is Night King & the Army of the Dead.

This trailer literally humanizes everyone in the cast as a final fellowship against the Thanos of Westeros making the politics of secondary importance against such a threat. The theme of the trailer was DEATH. UNITY. PERSEVERANCE. in the face of an oncoming doom.

Doesn’t Stop.

Gendry is in the show the last of the Baratheon line & a lot of people sensed tension between him & dany. The blood thirst that Robert showed towards targaryens, maybe gendry is the Baratheon, literally said to be a mirror of Roberts youth who puts a stop to the enemity with the Targaryens. He has been beyond the wall & knows daenerys & her dragons are the best chance at defence the living have!

Ser Jorah is Ned Stark’s fugitive in the north they still remember his crimes But even he has stopped his crimes, he isn’t a slaver anymore. Unlike the Night King he is a changed man. The night king has been at this creating an army against the living since the time Children of the forest lived in Westeros. He doesn’t Stop. He is the real enemy not Baratheon against Targaryen or Ser Jorah against the Justice of the North, but the Living against the Dead.

Doesn’t Feel.

am sure during the Northern Council northerners brought up the presence of a Targaryen along with foreign “slaves & savage” soldiers like Unsullied & the Dothraki. But these are first & the foremost humans who feel just like anyone in the council can feel, unlike the Dead who do not feel anything. Hence they aren’t the enemies either.

The Kingslayer is North’s fav enemy/Lost Prisoner. Plus also a Lannister. Jaime is an emotional fool even he feels things. Like Jon said in season 7 

“Jon: He’s right! We’re all on the same side.  

Gendry: How can we be?   

Jon: We’re all breathing." 

Plus Jaime himself said in the trailer that he wants to fight for the living. "I promised to fight for the living & I intend to keep that promise”

Hell the trailer even humanized Cersei ffs as someone who feels things. There is only one enemy to look forward to which is the Night King, only one enemy that matters to Jon & only one that he thinks should be fiercely opposed by the North which is Night King & the Army of the Dead.

This trailer literally humanizes everyone in the cast as a final fellowship against the Thanos of Westeros making the politics of secondary importance against such a threat. The theme of the trailer was DEATH. UNITY. PERSEVERANCE. in the face of an oncoming doom.

trail.content_raw:
What truly was the theme of that trailer..

Does it villainize any of the main human characters?

That trailer was all about the Key characters (four instead of five) It starts with Arya setting up the main focus of the trailer Death, she knows death & it’s many faces. Night King is the embodiment of death & by that another face of death. Then Bran accomplishing one of his important tasks this season, revealing Jon his true identity. Then starts the dialogue that sounds like Jon addressing the Northerners, who am sure will blab about daenerys & the dragons being in Winterfell & Jon basically reminding them who the real enemy actually is. He is defending Daenerys as north’s friend not a foe!

This trailer was about the common enemy all these characters will have to face together.

They’re Coming.

Our Enemy doesn’t Tire.

I love how the scene placements were done in this trailer. Specially for this ☝️ particular shot with the word TIRE. Because in a way both Dany & Jon are tired of the life, responsibilities, unwanted surprises & burdens that were thrust upon them

“Her whole life had been one long flight, it seemed. She had begun running in her mother’s womb, and never once stopped.”

-Daenerys ACOK

“I am tired of fighting. It’s all I’ve done since I left home..”

-Jon S06E04.

Both of them are tired in one or the other way of the things that they have faced all through their lives, that now upon receiving such a revelation both of them would have appreciated some extra time to deal with it but unlike them who are living breathing humans, whose enemies are neither each other nor the North, their real enemy is the Night King & the Dead & they don’t ever tire.

Doesn’t Stop.

This trailer literally humanizes everyone in the cast as a final fellowship against the Thanos of Westeros making the politics of secondary importance against such a threat. The theme of the trailer was DEATH. UNITY. PERSEVERANCE. in the face of an oncoming doom.

summary: I hope we’ll get a Stark sister hug in season 8, before the Winterfell battle. I want to see them worried for each other ! After...
body:
I hope we’ll get a Stark sister hug in season 8, before the Winterfell battle. I want to see them worried for each other !

After the shitstorm season 7 was, I need a healthy relationship between Sansa and Arya. Like, c’mon !

Sophie and Maisie have such an amazing friendship, let us see that !
